trans-unit.source: The following table lists quota information specific to Service Bus messaging.
trans-unit.target: The following table lists quota information specific to Service Bus messaging.

trans-unit.source: Event Hubs limits are included in this table, but for more specific information about Event Hubs, see <link><linkText>Event Hubs Pricing</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Event Hubs limits are included in this table, but for more specific information about Event Hubs, see <link><linkText>Event Hubs Pricing</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For information about pricing and other quotas for Service Bus, see the <link><linkText>Service Bus Pricing</linkText><title></title></link> overview.
trans-unit.target: For information about pricing and other quotas for Service Bus, see the <link><linkText>Service Bus Pricing</linkText><title></title></link> overview.

trans-unit.source: Maximum number of namespaces per Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: Maximum number of namespaces per Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: Subsequent requests for additional namespaces will be rejected by the Azure managment portal.
trans-unit.target: Subsequent requests for additional namespaces will be rejected by the Azure managment portal.

trans-unit.source: Defined upon creation of the queue/topic.
trans-unit.target: Defined upon creation of the queue/topic.

trans-unit.source: Incoming messages will be rejected and an exception will be received by the calling code.
trans-unit.target: Incoming messages will be rejected and an exception will be received by the calling code.

trans-unit.source: 1,2,3,4 or 5 GB.<html></html><html></html>If <link><linkText>partitioning</linkText><title></title></link> is enabled, the maximum queue/topic size is 80 GB.
trans-unit.target: 1,2,3,4 or 5 GB.<html></html><html></html>If <link><linkText>partitioning</linkText><title></title></link> is enabled, the maximum queue/topic size is 80 GB.

trans-unit.source: Number of concurrent connections on a namespace
trans-unit.target: Number of concurrent connections on a namespace

trans-unit.source: Subsequent requests for additional connections will be rejected and an exception will be received by the calling code.
trans-unit.target: Subsequent requests for additional connections will be rejected and an exception will be received by the calling code.

trans-unit.source: REST operations do not count towards concurrent TCP connections.
trans-unit.target: REST operations do not count towards concurrent TCP connections.

trans-unit.source: Number of concurrent connections on a queue/topic/subscription entity
trans-unit.target: Number of concurrent connections on a queue/topic/subscription entity

trans-unit.source: Subsequent requests for additional connections will be rejected and an exception will be received by the calling code.
trans-unit.target: Subsequent requests for additional connections will be rejected and an exception will be received by the calling code.

trans-unit.source: REST operations do not count towards concurrent TCP connections.
trans-unit.target: REST operations do not count towards concurrent TCP connections.

trans-unit.source: Capped by the limit of concurrent connections per namespace.
trans-unit.target: Capped by the limit of concurrent connections per namespace.

trans-unit.source: Number of concurrent receive requests on a queue/topic/subscription entity
trans-unit.target: Number of concurrent receive requests on a queue/topic/subscription entity

trans-unit.source: Subsequent receive requests will be rejected and an exception will be received by the calling code.
trans-unit.target: Subsequent receive requests will be rejected and an exception will be received by the calling code.

trans-unit.source: This quota applies to the combined number of concurrent receive operations across all subscriptions on a topic.
trans-unit.target: This quota applies to the combined number of concurrent receive operations across all subscriptions on a topic.

trans-unit.source: Number of concurrent listeners on a relay
trans-unit.target: Number of concurrent listeners on a relay

trans-unit.source: Subsequent requests for additional connections will be rejected and an exception will be received by the calling code.
trans-unit.target: Subsequent requests for additional connections will be rejected and an exception will be received by the calling code.

trans-unit.source: Subsequent requests for additional connections will be rejected and an exception will be received by the calling code.
trans-unit.target: Subsequent requests for additional connections will be rejected and an exception will be received by the calling code.

trans-unit.source: Number of concurrent relay connections per all relay endpoints in a service namespace
trans-unit.target: Number of concurrent relay connections per all relay endpoints in a service namespace

trans-unit.source: Number of relay endpoints per service namespace
trans-unit.target: Number of relay endpoints per service namespace

trans-unit.source: Number of topics/queues per service namespace
trans-unit.target: Number of topics/queues per service namespace

trans-unit.source: Subsequent requests for creation of a new topic or queue on the service namespace will be rejected.
trans-unit.target: Subsequent requests for creation of a new topic or queue on the service namespace will be rejected.

trans-unit.source: As a result, if configured through the management portal, an error message will be generated.
trans-unit.target: As a result, if configured through the management portal, an error message will be generated.

trans-unit.source: If called from the management API, an exception will be received by the calling code.
trans-unit.target: If called from the management API, an exception will be received by the calling code.

trans-unit.source: 10,000<html></html><html></html>The total number of topics plus queues in a service namespace must be less than or equal to 10,000.
trans-unit.target: 10,000<html></html><html></html>The total number of topics plus queues in a service namespace must be less than or equal to 10,000.

trans-unit.source: Number of partitioned topics/queues per service namespace
trans-unit.target: Number of partitioned topics/queues per service namespace

trans-unit.source: Subsequent requests for creation of a new partitioned topic or queue on the service namespace will be rejected.
trans-unit.target: Subsequent requests for creation of a new partitioned topic or queue on the service namespace will be rejected.

trans-unit.source: As a result, if configured through the management portal, an error message will be generated.
trans-unit.target: As a result, if configured through the management portal, an error message will be generated.

trans-unit.source: If called from the management API, a QuotaExceededException exception will be received by the calling code.
trans-unit.target: If called from the management API, a QuotaExceededException exception will be received by the calling code.

trans-unit.source: 100<html></html><html></html>Each partitioned queue or topic counts towards the quota of 10,000 entities per namespace.
trans-unit.target: 100<html></html><html></html>Each partitioned queue or topic counts towards the quota of 10,000 entities per namespace.

trans-unit.source: Maximum size of any messaging entity name: namespace, queue, topic, subscription, or event hub
trans-unit.target: Maximum size of any messaging entity name: namespace, queue, topic, subscription, or event hub

trans-unit.source: Maximum size of Event Hubs event
trans-unit.target: Maximum size of Event Hubs event

trans-unit.source: Message size for a queue/topic/subscription entity
trans-unit.target: Message size for a queue/topic/subscription entity

trans-unit.source: Incoming messages that exceed these quotas will be rejected and an exception will be received by the calling code.
trans-unit.target: Incoming messages that exceed these quotas will be rejected and an exception will be received by the calling code.

trans-unit.source: Note Due to system overhead, this limit is usually slightly less than 256KB.Maximum header size: 64KBMaximum number of header properties in property bag: MaxValueMaximum size of property in property bag: No explicit limit.
trans-unit.target: Note Due to system overhead, this limit is usually slightly less than 256KB.Maximum header size: 64KBMaximum number of header properties in property bag: MaxValueMaximum size of property in property bag: No explicit limit.

trans-unit.source: Incoming messages that exceed these quotas will be rejected and an exception will be received by the calling code.
trans-unit.target: Incoming messages that exceed these quotas will be rejected and an exception will be received by the calling code.

trans-unit.source: Message property size for a queue/topic/subscription entity
trans-unit.target: Message property size for a queue/topic/subscription entity

trans-unit.source: Maximum message property size for each property is 32K.
trans-unit.target: Maximum message property size for each property is 32K.

trans-unit.source: Cumulative size of all properties cannot exceed 64K.
trans-unit.target: Cumulative size of all properties cannot exceed 64K.

trans-unit.source: This applies to the entire header of the <link><linkText>BrokeredMessage</linkText><title></title></link>, which has both user properties as well as system properties (such as <link><linkText>SequenceNumber</linkText><title></title></link>, <link><linkText>Label</linkText><title></title></link>, <link><linkText>MessageId</linkText><title></title></link>, and so on).
trans-unit.target: This applies to the entire header of the <link><linkText>BrokeredMessage</linkText><title></title></link>, which has both user properties as well as system properties (such as <link><linkText>SequenceNumber</linkText><title></title></link>, <link><linkText>Label</linkText><title></title></link>, <link><linkText>MessageId</linkText><title></title></link>, and so on).

trans-unit.source: Subsequent requests for creating additional subscriptions for the topic will be rejected.
trans-unit.target: Subsequent requests for creating additional subscriptions for the topic will be rejected.

trans-unit.source: As a result, if configured through the management portal, an error message will be shown.
trans-unit.target: As a result, if configured through the management portal, an error message will be shown.

trans-unit.source: If called from the management API an exception will be received by the calling code.
trans-unit.target: If called from the management API an exception will be received by the calling code.

trans-unit.source: Number of SQL filters per topic
trans-unit.target: Number of SQL filters per topic

trans-unit.source: Subsequent requests for creation of additional filters on the topic will be rejected and an exception will be received by the calling code.
trans-unit.target: Subsequent requests for creation of additional filters on the topic will be rejected and an exception will be received by the calling code.

trans-unit.source: Number of correlation filters per topic
trans-unit.target: Number of correlation filters per topic

trans-unit.source: Subsequent requests for creation of additional filters on the topic will be rejected and an exception will be received by the calling code.
trans-unit.target: Subsequent requests for creation of additional filters on the topic will be rejected and an exception will be received by the calling code.

trans-unit.source: Subsequent requests for creation of additional filters will be rejected and an exception will be received by the calling code.
trans-unit.target: Subsequent requests for creation of additional filters will be rejected and an exception will be received by the calling code.

trans-unit.source: Maximum length of filter condition string: 1024 (1K).<html></html><html></html>Maximum length of rule action string: 1024 (1K).<html></html><html></html>Maximum number of expressions per rule action: 32.
trans-unit.target: Maximum length of filter condition string: 1024 (1K).<html></html><html></html>Maximum length of rule action string: 1024 (1K).<html></html><html></html>Maximum number of expressions per rule action: 32.
